title: Simon H. Fell Sextet 2015 The Ragging Of Time
description: SFS ~ The Ragging Of Time ~ 2015 Bruce's Fingers BF 127. http://i2.imageban.ru/out/2017/07/30/48f9caf93707a61cd1c803cf886bc4fe.jpg Composition No 79 1 Lebam Lebam (Un Cauchemar) 23:19 2 Unstable Cylindrical Structure 12:07 3 The Human Omelette (1926) 21:06 Shabaka Hutchings: bass clarinet Alex Ward: clarinet Simon H. Fell: double bass Paul Hession: drum set Richard Comte: guitar Percy Pursglove: trumpet The work is in three sections and the band immediately launches into a Morton-esque theme, bouncy and reasonably convincing, before quickly veering into a free improvisation featuring some blistering clarinet work from Ward. In microcosm, this is the model in use throughout: areas of thematic material interlaced or overlaid with a fairly aggressive but not atypical (within efi) improvised section, sometimes with written lines traced in the background, recalling (for me) a strategy used by Braxton among others. Different attacks and groupings are apparently scored with exactitude as the shifts within a given section are crisp and finely contrasting. All of the playing is first rate, especially Ward and Hutchings (the latter a name new to me) and I guess if you listen to the music from a post-Bailey, etc. point of view, you'll be well satisfied. - Brian Olewnick, JUST OUTSIDE

parsed.dn: Simon H. Fell Sextet 2015 The Ragging Of Time
